definitions.text: the location on a baseball field where the shortstop is stationed
accidental contact between two points in an electric circuit that have a potential difference
the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed between second and third base
cheat someone by not returning him enough money
create a short circuit in
primarily temporal sense; indicating or being or seeming to be limited in duration
(primarily spatial sense) having little length or lacking in length
examples: the board was a foot short

definitions.text: low in stature; not tall
not sufficient to meet a need
(of memory) deficient in retentiveness or range
not holding securities or commodities that one sells in expectation of a fall in prices
of speech sounds or syllables of relatively short duration
examples: the English vowel sounds in `pat', `pet', `pit', `pot', putt' are short

definitions.text: less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so
lacking foresight or scope
examples: a short view of the problem

definitions.text: tending to crumble or break into flakes due to a large amount of shortening
examples: shortbread is a short crumbly cookie

definitions.text: marked by rude or peremptory shortness
examples: try to cultivate a less brusque manner
the salesgirl was very short with him

definitions.text: quickly and without warning
without possessing something at the time it is contractually sold
examples: he made his fortune by selling short just before the crash

definitions.text: clean across
at some point or distance before a goal is reached
examples: he fell short of our expectations

definitions.text: so as to interrupt
examples: She took him up short before he could continue

definitions.text: at a disadvantage
in a curt, abrupt and discourteous manner
examples: he told me curtly to get on with it
he said shortly that he didn't like it
